intro: Zanthoxylum matudae, commonly known as Matuda's prickly ash, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to Mexico. It is a small to medium-sized shrub characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy fruits that are edible and often consumed by various wildlife species. Zanthoxylum matudae is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
